data.title: Horrible service and mediocre food at best.
data.text: Went with friends to dinner. The restaurant was not busy yet the service was painfully slow and poor. The food was unmemorable at best. Will never return to this establishment. There are plenty of Italian restaurant options other than this one. They definitely need more wait staff.

data.title: Grand!
data.text: Though eggplant was not on the menu.... I was able to have it specially made. Let me tell you it was the most amazing I've ever had. Our server was super sweet and attentive. Dessert was delish!

data.title: Wow
data.text: Let's start with the bread,  some of the best bread I have had.  I also had the linguine and clams, first time trying this and it was good.  The paste en pesto was very good. I have saved the best for last, I had costata di maiale, pork chop in a mushroom glaze and it was to die for. .. my life is now complete. Lol

data.title: Not so great.
data.text: We were so excited to try this place.  We were a larger group, on a weekend, and had the place to ourselves.  The server was very nice, and split the checks by groups of just a few, which really helped.  Pretty much everyone ordered the pannini sandwich which was ok, with the side veggie chips.  It was a lot of bread, but the cheese was delicious.  One pasta didn't look appetizing.  Too bad, because we were looking forward to this place for lunch.  So sorry.  We will have to try it again because the former reviews gave it such high marks, and the servers were friendly.  Must have been an off day for them.

data.title: Nice Experience
data.text:
We visited recently with friends, who live locally and know the Ristorante well (and the owners.)  The owners had actually just returned from Italy, having attended a family wedding.

Our server was very pleasant.  It was not very busy, I think due to the fact that it had been closed for a couple weeks and the owners literally had just arrived back. 

The bread was delicious and different!  There is a nice selection of dishes - really no vegetarian, but maybe if you ask they can accommodate.  Because of the recent trip, a couple of the dishes were not available.  

Portion sizes were generous; I took my leftovers and had a couple more small meals.

data.title: Dining Alfresco
data.text: patio or indoor dining with authentic Italian dishes. Loved the lobster ravioli. Good collection of beer and wines served as well.

data.title: Excellent Uptown Eatery!
data.text:
Stopped by this mid-sized Italian restaurant about 7 pm on a Wednesday evening. Not too many customers inside, we were greeted promptly and seated in a comfortable spot. 

This seems like a typical family or mom and pop type establishment. It seems to be run by family and they all do their jobs very well. From being super attentive to us (we had two small kids with us) or just being helpful, they were over the top nice. My granddaughter who is three and a half was super hungry and we were going to try an appetizer, but the older lady who was serving us asked if we would like her meal brought out first so she could get started on it. Yes, please!!! It made all the difference that my granddaughter got to eat before she really got cranky and hungry. After all, she wasn't going to be trying the caprese salad like we did.  
On that note, the Caprese Salad appetizer was delicious. The tomatoes could have been a bit riper, but overall it was delicious and tasty. Plenty to share as well. The house bread basket was interesting and sort of a blend of a garlic bread/foccacia. They serve you ice cold water in a charming way; out of wine bottles. It gives a touch of european elegance to an otherwise simply meal.

For the adults we bought the Ciao Special pizza, which has cappicola and sopressato salami in addition to a light tomato basil sauce. Crust was crispy and delicious, I am sure they make their dough in house due to it's flavor.  We also tried the cheese ravioli and linguine with clam sauce. All delicious and technically correct. The pasta in the ravioli dish as well as the linguine tasted house made and was well appreciated. 

We saw they had desserts available and if we had shared more and ordered less we could have possibly tried some dessert, however we were all way too full and even took a lot home for lunch the next day.  For what you get, the prices are wonderful, three adults and two kids for less than $70 including tip.  Great deal, especially since we had an appetizer and we couldn't ask for better service.

If you are in the mood for a family atmosphere and good solid Italian food, try this place!

data.title: Lovely evening, great service, excellent food
data.text: I found this restaurant on Trip Advisor and decided to give it a try.  We had a large party (9) and were able to secure reservations and a nice table right near the evening jazz combo.  We started our dining with two bottles of wine (A Chianti and a Sangiovese) both with affordable price points. Our starter was a pizza and then we dove into the menu selections for a variety of entrees.  We all enjoyed our food, our service was perfect for our party: attentive and not rushed.  I highly recommend.

data.title: Great Italian Restaurant
data.text:
Once we walked into Ciao we were greeted like we were family and the service got even better!
The owner came to our table and made sure everything was OK and to our liking. He recommended a wine for dinner that matched our preference exactly. The best part of our evening was the food, fabulous! There were four of us and we each ordered a different entree and each one was very good. We will be going back many times!

data.title: Italian Birthday Party!
data.text: The restaurants in uptown Whittier are getting better and better and this one is no exception.  We wanted to celebrate a family birthday and Ciao Italia was the ticket.  The food was great and the staff were very friendly and attentive.  We all loved our dinners and the wine, recommended by the  owner, complimented our food perfectly.  They serve only Italian wine and I think almost all of the ingredients in the food are imported from Italy.  They also have photos of Valentino Rossi in the bar area!  Can't beat that!

data.title: Olive Oil There is no butter!
data.text: Staff was incredible.  My husband asked for butter for the bread and wife/ owner brought out container of olive oil! Hilarious! We all enjoyed her jest and they kept coming to entertain and educate us in the Italian culture.  The pesto is amazing and the Simple spaghetti is anything but. after all the import their tomatoes from Italy!  Don't forget the Cannoli- we came back next day for more! Their Veal is so tender and plenty to share-  Staff so kind to allow are big group to invade at 11:00pm  Thanks you so very much.

data.title: Good food and unique place
data.text: Went here for my birthday. I was kind of skeptical, but it all tasted absolutely wonderful. The butternut ravioli was amazing.

data.title: A day in Italy
data.text: I have eaten my way all over Italy. So when I am home and I need a day to escape back to Italy I just go to Ciao Italia. The food is authentic and fantastic. Plus the owners are absolutely warm and wonderful. You will feel like you're part of the family. It is great for small and large groups. We recently had a large party there and everything was amazing.

data.title: The best Italian Restaurant in Los Angeles Area
data.text: The best Italian food is here, great services,good food and a family atmosphere, where every ingredient coffee or water until the tomato comes from Italy. The best Italian Restaurant in all Los Angeles Area

data.title: I thought it couldn't get better, but it did!
data.text: Ciao Italia Panini Grill has moved & they changed their name to Ciao Italia Ristorante, 13112 Philadelphia St, Whittier CA 90601.  The owners (from Calabria, Italia) are Maurizio & Rosanna are the most gracious hosts, they make you feel like family (true Italian hospitality).  My wife & I use to go to restaurant on Painter & the panini were out of this world.  We lived in the next town & it took 30 mins to get there; well worth it.  Now, they just opened their new restaurant & I held my 60th birthday party there (about 20 guests).  Everyone raved about the food & said they would return.  Service is phenomenal & the whole family helps out.  I recommend that you try Ciao Italia Restaurante soon before the word gets out.

data.title: Good sandwich.
data.text: Found this place on yelp.  Surprisingly, sandwich was so good. Ordered panini on the lunch manual ( ordered sausage and pepper Panini). Services was good.  Casual place. Good for hand out, or watch game on TV. Will go back again for Panini for sure.

data.title: Good Tatste & Fresh food
data.text: Just by chance we stopped to a great surprise. The food is good and fresh, made at that moment.

data.title: Leave the country in a few steps
data.text: The atmoshere, the map on the wall and the ever present soccer games on the tv feels like you've wandered into a foreign place without leaving the streets of Whittier. The owners do a nice job of making you feel at home. It's not fast food, but food prepared with thought and care. The vegies are crisp, mozzarella fresh and moist, and meats chosen with care. When I have time on a Saturday I walk down the 1/2 mile grab a sandwich and take my time walking back through the college and the shady streets of Whittier. I'm sure it's a great place for weekday lunches too, but allow a bit of time.

data.title: Great panini!!!
data.text: I give Ciao Italia a 10+.  I walked in this cozy and colorful restaurant and it won me over, from the food to the staff and back.  This is a family who loves everything fresh and flavorful and wanted to bring their best to you. They come from Calabria, Italy, where food has a definite punch-of-flavor to it!  For me, it was an out-of-the-ordinary experience to live through.  I savored each bite to the last as if it were the first all over again!  I really wasn't drawn to panini before as I do now, but they have to come from Ciao Italia!   It's a clean, wonderful, and healthy mediterranean experience.

data.title: We are hooked!
data.text: We finally made it to this Panini Grill last month.  Let me tell you that once you have gone in and had one their Panini right off that grill you will never eat another sandwich anywhere else!!!  The taste of all those freshly sliced deli meats with the combination of the ingredients in their Panini are undescribable.  We had their #8 which has everything in it ...wow ...excellent and we were lucky enough to go on a day that the wife had made a special order of crape canneloni. My wife had those and she was delighted.  We are 2d genaration Italians and these canneloni were  the best we had ever had even better than mom.  If you haven't been there yet ...you must go and  eat there the place is super clean and the staff which is all family are great!!
